result.execSummary:
All charges against Clara M Koontz in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Clara M Koontz is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clara M Koontz

records.addlTxt: Defendant Clara M Koontz in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Clara M Koontz in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Clara M Koontz appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has not been turned over to the State of Missouri. State motions that Missouri released the previous hold on the defendant. On motion of the state, Court ordered case closed.

Defendant Clara M Koontz in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Clara M Koontz in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of Missouri Defendant waived extradition.  Signed Waiver of Extradition received and filed.  Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
